title: Installing the G-Series MK6/MK7 (for Infiniti Q50/Q60, 2014-2019)

topLevelComment.text: I added the GPS antena right on top of the CD tray in case anyone is wondering where to put it. The 4g antennas and sim card tray same as ROB. A huge THANKS to Rob for these videos. Super helpful. Installed in just under a few hours (would have been even quicker if it didn't start raining and then there was beer).

topLevelComment.text: I was able to get the 4G sim card tray and the USB connectors into the glove box. I had to use a fishing stick (the kind you use for in wall wire installs) and stick it in sideways. Removing the glove compartment box (the screws that hold the entire glove compartment assembly) helped a lot in getting the cables routed there.

topLevelComment.text: My Mark 6 for my Infiniti 2020 Q50 is working fine with the exception of there is still no sound or volume when I play through the Android side of the Mark 6. When I play music through my AM, FM or XM Radio it plays fine.  When I play a YouTube video it plays fine but without music or sound. When I go back to the screen to check my input selection it has automatically moved it to the AUX setting. Does the Mark 6 have an AUX out plug somewhere on it that I can plug into my AUX in on my Infiniti Q50? If it does, will you please send me a photo of where it is located on the Mark 6? I believe that will make it work correctly. If you of any other way to get this to work I would appreciate it. Thanks Robert
topLevelComment.author: @robertbyrd3926

replies.text: it should have come with a small L-shaped adapter to plug in the AUX port under your armrest

topLevelComment.text: Thank you for the videos, you are truly amazing. I have a question. I noticed that since I've installed this when I go to charge my phone from the USB it's a slow charging and basically doesn't even charge my phone. Any suggestions?
topLevelComment.author: @ineed2travel

replies.text:
Yeah the USB ports don't supply enough amperage to fast charge. Sometimes, depending on what's running on the phone, it doesn't charge at all as you mention. I only use the included USB ports for thumb drives and accessories, and have a fast charger hooked up in my arm rest to keep my phone topped up.

Thanks for watching man, enjoy that MK6 ü§òüòé
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: Don‚Äôt know if mine was installed incorrectly but when I go to CarPlay it doesn‚Äôt play any audio, but I go to the factory menu from the top screen and go to Bluetooth on that I can hear my music, and then I switch back to CarPlay and it goes off again. Any help please?
topLevelComment.author: @234RandomGuy

replies.text: Based on what you said, your phone's playing through bluetooth instead of CarPlay.  Change the output on your phone from bluetooth to CarPlay.

topLevelComment.text: Im having trouble with setting up the sim card Adapter. The sim card doesn‚Äôt pop up on the screen
topLevelComment.author: @ronaldom.6122

replies.text: Alright I fixed it somehow I basically did all the wiring steps all over again and also spread out the 4G antennas to the each side panel of the dashboard and now i have 4G service üëçüèº
replies.author: @ronaldom.6122

replies.text: I left the sim card in the adapter and then proceeded to unplug and make sure all the connections were in all the way and in the correct spot. I also used the 2 black antennas and spread each one to the side panels of the dashboard. Then when i put everything back together the sim card popped up and i had service. @djokoben
replies.author: @ronaldom.6122

replies.text: @djokoben yeah, the way i did it the phone company asked for my ‚ÄúIMEI‚Äù of the device to connect you can find that number in the sim settings
replies.author: @ronaldom.6122

replies.text: Make sure you're holding down the physical home button for 10s after installing the SIM. It'll Force the unit to reboot, and then it should detect the Sim once it starts back up
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

replies.text: @djokoben use 1
replies.author: @ronaldom.6122

replies.text: @djokoben no problem bro
replies.author: @ronaldom.6122

replies.text: @ronaldom.6122 do you know if it‚Äôs compatible with Verizon?
replies.author: @majareshe

replies.text: @majareshe I believe this screen is unlocked so it should be compatible. Speak to verizon they‚Äôll most likely ask for the IMEI of the screen to check
replies.author: @ronaldom.6122

topLevelComment.text: Does it work for 2020 and beyond q50/q60?
topLevelComment.author: @syriusblacc9746

replies.text: Yep - pick the 2020+ variant on the site

topLevelComment.text: Bought and installed the unit and had one quick question, does the reverse camera automatically pop up when you put the car in reverse? I have to press the camera button on the console for the reverse camera to show up and even then it defaults to the front view or 360 view. Not sure if there's something I need to configure for it to automatically show the reverse camera when the cars in reverse
topLevelComment.author: @rc28ify

replies.text: Automatically shows reverse camera when switching to reverse. Sounds like the units not detecting the car is in reverse. Check all your connections again, make sure all plugs are seated securely üëçüèæ
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: Can I hook up visor monitors to this unit
topLevelComment.author: @deydeybrown4824

replies.text: It doesn't have any video output connections. The only option I can think of would be something that puts video out via USB.
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: hey, so i installed the MARK6 Aucar screen and for some reason the audio is not working when i come to use youtube or netflix or any app that has audio. but when i come to connect my phone to carplay on the screen it plays music from my apple music app. what am i doing wrong üò©
topLevelComment.author: @yosefjaber5321

replies.text: Probably have your car's source set to Bluetooth audio instead of AUX
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: Ordered and got my unit from you guys last week. Installed. The unit is most impressive but I am having issues using CarPlay.  Bluetooth music on the MK7 sounds great. When I connect to CarPlay the music /sound goes to sh!t, it sounds as if audio switches from all speakers and only comes out the front dashboard speakers only. I have the Bose system in my Q50. I've tried all things I can think of. Is there an update I am missing? I rely on CarPlay and am frustrated, I need to find a solution. Do I reach out to Aucar support ? Pls help
topLevelComment.author: @ICregular

replies.text: hit support@squarewheelsauto.com if you haven't already - we'll get you on your way
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: Installed the mark 6 today on my 2017 q60s and noticed the rear camera didn‚Äôt have the back up lines on it is there a fix for that
topLevelComment.author: @kirennrhodd1014

replies.text: Enable 'reverse guidelines' in user settings.
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: Hello! Are the gps navigator indications still visible in the instrument panel?
topLevelComment.author: @Lockley2010

replies.text: Probably, if you still use the OEM nav. But most people defer to Google maps or Waze or any other navigation app which is far superior to the OEM nav. If you use the apps they obviously won't show on the dash.
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto
